page.title: 14HEALTH IN LAUGHARNE
page.content: Medical facilities are Morning Surgery weekdays, three family practitioners in partnership. Another doctor in St Clears with surgery. 4 district nurses and midwives with ante-natal and baby clinics and health visitor. State chiropody for OAPs, dentists in St Clears and Carmarthen on NHS. Home Help Service, part-time Day Centre planned for 1986. Main illnesses are heart attacks and strokes, osteo- and rheumatoid arthritis are common and all the cancers, particularly of the lung, very rarely Farmer's Lung. Diabetes of late maturity onset common and a high incidence of gall-stones. Smoking is decreasing but alcohol intake is considered by Doctors to be too high. Infant mortality rate very low in common with rest of W Wales. In winter, mothers bring their small children's coughs to morning Surgery.
